brief_summary.textblock:
This study will evaluate safety and efficacy of d-Amphetamine Transdermal System for the
      treatment of Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder in children and adolescents.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Safety & Efficacy of d-Amphetamine Transdermal System Compared to Placebo in Children & Adolescents With ADHD

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will consist of a four-week screening period, a 3-day wash-out period (if
      applicable), a five-week open-label, step-wise dose optimization period and two-week double
      blind randomized crossover treatment period with weekly classroom assessments and a safety
      follow-up by telephone 7 - 10 days after last dose of study drug.

intervention.description: Patches will be worn for 9 hours every day. After 9 hours the patch will be removed. Every day a new patch will be applied.
Patches will be worn for 9 hours every day. After 9 hours the patch will be removed. Every day a new patch will be applied.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover, Laboratory Classroom Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of d-Amphetamine Transdermal Drug Delivery System (d-ATS) Compared to Placebo in Children and Adolescents With ADHD

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in total SKAMP Scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured weekly during a  two-week double-blind treatment period

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
